resources.string: Change the name of this game to:
Change the name of this game (on this device only) to:

Are you sure you want to delete the games %1$s? This action cannot be undone.

resources.string:
Rematch successful.

Do you now want to delete the completed game %1$s? 

(This action cannot be undone.)

plurals.name: confirm_reset_fmt
plurals.item: Are you sure you want to reset the selected game?\n\n(Resetting erases all moves and any connection information.)

plurals.name: confirm_delete_dict_fmt
plurals.item: Are you sure you want to delete the wordlist %1$s?
Are you sure you want to delete the wordlists %1$s?

resources.string: Deleting %1$s will leave you without any %2$s wordlists. One or more games will be unopenable (until you download a replacement list.)
For what players should the wordlist %1$s be the default for new games? (The language %2$s will be the default for both.)
How smart should the robot player be?
How to handle “phonies” (words not in wordlist)
At least one player must be marked “Remote” for a game started as Host.
This game is in play. If you save these changes it must be restarted. Do you want to save these changes?
In a multi-device game there must be at least one player from and another not from this device. Please check off-device players.
Trading tiles. Tap tiles to select…
This game is configured to expect a remote player. \n\nWould you like to invite someone?

plurals.name: invite_msg_fmt
plurals.item:
This game is waiting for one remote player to receive and respond to an invitation.
\n\nYou will see this message until the invited player has responded.

This game is waiting for %1$d remote players to repond to invitations.
\n\nYou will see this message until all expected players have responded.

resources.string: If you suspect an invitation you sent was lost, there’s no harm in sending another.
With rematches, all necessary invitations will have been created automatically and will be resent until they are accepted.
Invite sent via Data SMS to phone number %1$s on %2$s
This option launches your default SMS app with an invitation ready to send—when it works. Each SMS app is different, and some won’t cooperate.
Invite sent via Bluetooth to paired device “%1$s” on %2$s
Invite sent via %1$s on %2$s. Recipient unknown.
Invite forwarded via MQTT/internet to Known Player “%1$s” on %2$s.
To invite via QR code, let your opponent scan the code with the camera on their Android phone.
The game named “%1$s” has been deleted on another device. You will not be able to play any further.
\u0020Do you still want to accept this move?

plurals.item: (If you choose the “%1$s” button you will not be asked about this word again.)
(If you choose the “%1$s” button you will not be asked about these words again.)

%1$d tiles left in pool and hidden trays:\n

resources.string: Are you sure you want to undo the last committed turn? (There is no redo option.)
Are you sure you want to restore all color settings to their default values?
Are you sure you want to restore all settings to their default values?
Hiding the game name lets the board be slightly larger
Hiding the newgame buttons in the main screen makes more games visible
Tapped rack tiles land on this arrow when it is visible
Edit colors used on the board
Display score summary after every robot or remote turn
Do NOT display score summary after every human turn
Sort racks whenever new tiles are added
Tapping on scoreboard name shows that player’s tiles
Do not show which board cell is touched
Settings that apply to networked games
QR code your opponent can scan
Tap the full link below to join this game. <br \\> <br \\> (Full link: %1$s )
Tap the link to accept my invitation and join a CrossWords game: %1$s

plurals.name: query_trade_fmt
plurals.item: Are you sure you want to exchange the selected tile (%2$s)?
Are you sure you want to exchange the %1$d selected tiles (%2$s)?

resources.string: All tiles played must be in a line.
Empty squares cannot separate tiles played.
Must play two or more pieces on the first move.
New pieces must contact others already in place (or the middle square on the first move)
You can’t do that; it’s not your turn!
No peeking at the robot’s tiles!
No peeking at remote players’ tiles!
Too few tiles left to exchange.

plurals.name: too_many_trade_fmt
plurals.item: Too many tiles selected. Please select only one.
Too many tiles selected. Please select no more than %1$d.

resources.string: The hint feature is disabled for this game. Enable it for a new game using the Settings dialog.
Refused attempt to register unexpected user.
Conflict between Host and Guest wordlists; Host wins.
Game “%1$s” requires a %2$s wordlist. Please download one to open it.

Unable to open game “%1$s” because wordlist %2$s not found. (It may have been deleted, or stored on an external card that is no longer available.)\n\nYou can download a replacement or substitute another %3$s wordlist.
Are you sure you want to resign?

You are entering tile-exchange mode.

Tap tiles to add/remove them from the set to be exchanged.
Use the buttons to commit your turn or exit exchange mode.
Use the menu or action bar to commit your turn or exit exchange mode.
This button shows all possible moves in ascending order by score.\n\n(Only tiles to the right of the draggable rack divider are used.)
This button shows all possible moves in descending order by score.\n\n(Only tiles to the right of the draggable rack divider are used.)
This button randomly rearranges tiles in the rack.
This button flips the board across a diagonal axis.
This button undos or redoes the current turn.
This button opens the screen for messaging between devices in this game. Messages will be kept until you delete the game that contains them.
This button changes whether the board shows values (in addition to letters) on tiles on the board.
Tapping the “pts” counter that appears at the right end of the rack is the easiest way to commit a move.
This game is in play. Some settings, e.g. the number of players, cannot be changed without restarting it. When you leave this page you will have a chance to discard changes to avoid a restart.

There are two ways to move tiles to the board. 

 • You can drag them between the rack and the board. 


• Or you can tap an empty square on the board to place the “board arrow.” Then tiles in the rack replace the arrow when you tap them. Tap the arrow to change its direction or to hide it.
The player whose turn it is is drawn large in the scoreboard.\n\nHold your finger on a name in the scoreboard to get details about that player’s most recent move.
Please enter your name here. It will be used when creating new games. (You can change it later in the “New game default” section of Settings.)
CrossWords for Android \nCopyright (C) 1998-2025 by Eric House. This free/open source software is released under the GNU Public License.
For an (old) manual or sourcecode see: http://xwords.sf.net/android.php. To report bugs, suggest features, offer to help, etc., please email: xwords@eehouse.org.
Credits: Toolbar icons by Sarah Chu. Navbar icons from the Noun Project: “archive” by Trendy; “rematch” by Becris; and “swap” by iconomania. Localization by volunteers via weblate.org.
Tap to look up or study
This button lets you look up, online, the words just played.

Archiving uses a special group called “Archive” to store finished games you want to keep. And, since deleting an entire archive is easy, archiving is also a great way to mark games for deletion – if that’s what you prefer to do.\n\n(Deleting the Archive group is safe because it will be created anew when needed.)
This button lets you browse the most recently viewed wordlist.
This button lets you choose which wordlist in the current game language to browse.
The minimum length value cannot be greater than the maximum value.

You can filter wordlists by what words start with, end with, and/or contain. Access filtering by tapping the Expander Arrow at the upper-right corner of the window.\n\nRead more in the FAQ by tapping the button below.
This new setting changes the number of tiles in the rack.\n\nNote: if anyone in your networked game is using an older version of CrossWords this setting will revert to 7 for everyone in the game.
(If relevant, please include the version (“%1$s”) of CrossDbg, the make/model (“%2$s”) and OS version (%3$s) of your phone or tablet, and your devID (%4$s).)
A player on the device %1$s wants to start a game
Tap to open the new game
The version of CrossWords on “%1$s” is incompatible with this one for play using Bluetooth. One of you may need to upgrade before you can continue.
The version of CrossWords on the phone with number “%1$s” is incompatible with this one for play using Data SMS. One of you may need to upgrade before you can continue.

plurals.name: invite_bt_desc_fmt_2
plurals.item: Please check the device you want to include in this game.
Please check up to %1$d devices you want to include in this game.

resources.string: \n\n(The list is of paired devices where CrossWords has been detected via a scan.)

plurals.name: bt_scan_progress_fmt
plurals.item: Scanning for CrossWords on %1$d paired devices

resources.string: Bluetooth send to %1$s failed; retry %3$d in %2$d seconds.
Bluetooth sends to %1$s have failed too many times. Re-open the game to try again.

plurals.name: invite_sms_desc_fmt
plurals.item: Please check the phone number you want to invite to your new game, then tap “%2$s”.
Please check the %1$d phone numbers you want to invite to your new game, then tap “%2$s”.

resources.string: A data message will then be delivered to the device with that phone number. If CrossWords is installed there and has the necessary permissions it will receive the invitation and play can begin.

plurals.name: invite_p2p_desc_fmt
plurals.item: Please select the name of the WiFiDirect device you want to invite to your new game, then tap “%2$s”.
Please select the %1$d WiFiDirect device names you want to invite to your new game, then tap “%2$s”.

resources.string: Only devices that are currently available are shown. If a nearby device isn’t showing up please make sure that WiFi is turned on, that CrossWords is installed, and that play via WiFi Direct is enabled.
The number %1$s for %2$s is not a “mobile” number. Import anyway?
This phone list is empty. Use the “Import contact” button to add people you want to invite, the + button to enter numbers directly.
There are currently no devices reachable via WiFiDirect that have CrossWords installed.

plurals.name: confirm_clear_sms_fmt
plurals.item: Are you sure you want to delete the checked phone number?
Are you sure you want to delete the %1$d checked phone numbers?

plurals.name: confirm_clear_bt_fmt
plurals.item: Are you sure you want to forget the checked device?
Are you sure you want to forget %1$d checked devices?

resources.string: \n\n(You can only re-add devices that are within Bluetooth range.)
Are you certain this number is on an account with unlimited texting? Tap “Cancel” if you are not.

This networked game has no way to connect and cannot be played.\n\n(It was probably created from an invitation that didn’t specify any way of connecting that your device supports, or you may have recently removed its last way of connecting.)
Network status for game (ID=%2$X) connected via %1$s:
Only if you have unlimited texting!

Warning: This feature is meant for phones with unlimited texting plans. Once you enable it dozens of Data SMS messages will be sent (invisibly) for each game played. If you don’t have an unlimited plan your carrier may charge you for each and every message!\n\nShould play via Data SMS be enabled?
Yes: I’ll pay all carrier charges
Play via Data SMS is currently disabled. No moves will be sent via Data SMS.\n\nYou can enable play via Data SMS now, or later.
Bluetooth play is currently disabled, and no moves will be exchanged via Bluetooth until it is enabled.\n\nYou can enable Bluetooth now, or later.
Internet play is currently disabled on this device. No moves will be sent or received via the internet.
You can enable internet play now, or later.
You can enable internet play now, or remove it from this game.

Are you sure you want to disable play using the internet? \n\n Most two-device games exchange moves via the internet, so only do this if you plan to play ALL games against a robot on this same device.

Are you sure you want to disable play using Bluetooth? \n\nBluetooth is useful for exchanging moves, and especially invitations, with devices physically close to you. Unless you’re certain you won’t play against anybody nearby there’s little harm in leaving it on.

plurals.name: warn_mqtt_games_fmt
plurals.item: \n\n(You have one active game using the internet now.)
\n\n(You have %1$d active games using the internet now.)

plurals.name: warn_bt_games_fmt
plurals.item: \n\n(You have one active game using Bluetooth.)

resources.string: You and the host of this game are using different versions of the wordlist %1$s.
You are using the wordlist %1$s but the game host is using %2$s. Would you like to use %3$s too?
\u0020(You will have to download it first.)
Tap to download %1$s wordlist and recover
%1$s has invited you to play CrossWords using the wordlist %2$s (for play in %3$s), but it is not installed. Would you like to download the wordlist or decline the invitation?
You have been invited to play CrossWords using the wordlist %2$s (for play in %3$s), but it is not installed. Would you like to download the wordlist?
E.g. where email attachments are saved

plurals.name: groups_confirm_del_fmt
plurals.item: Are you sure you want to delete the group %1$s?
Are you sure you want to delete the groups %1$s?

resources.string: Change the name of this group to:
The group “%1$s” cannot be deleted now because it is the group where new games are placed.
Check the “%1$s” box to move this game to the %2$s group.
Check the “%1$s” box to delete this game.
Are you sure you want to delete the current game? \n\n(This action cannot be undone.)
Even if they can be taller

Tapping a game’s listing opens the game.

Unless you tap the icons at the left. Tapping there selects or deselects games (or groups). 

Once you have one or more items selected use the menu or “Actionbar”, e.g. to delete every selected game.
The back button clears any selection instead of exiting. Hit it again to exit the app.
This invitation has already been used to create a game.
NFC is turned off on this device. You can use the Android Settings app to turn it on .
Offer to add to and display lists of words to remember

plurals.name: confirm_studylist_clear_fmt
plurals.item: Are you sure you want to delete the selected word?\n\n(This action cannot be undone.)
Are you sure you want to delete the %1$d selected words?\n\n(This action cannot be undone.)

resources.string: The selected words will be copied to the system clipboard. You can then paste them into any app that supports pasting text, e.g. an email app.
Unable to fetch wordlist information from server.
Updates are available for one or more installed wordlists. Would you like to download the new version[s] of %1$s now?

This screen lets you install new wordlists and view the ones you already have.

What wordlists you have installed determines:
• What languages you can play in
• How smart the robot player is
• What words are legal

Check the “Show downloadable” box at the top to see what’s available.

You currently have no paired Bluetooth devices (or Bluetooth is turned off). Would you like to open the Android Settings Panel to add one or more?\n\n(You may also need to open the Settings panel on the device you want to pair with.)
Unable to connect via Bluetooth to CrossWords on the device %1$s. Please check that the device is within Bluetooth range and that CrossWords is installed on it.
Duplicate invitation rejected: device “%1$s” has already accepted an invitation to this game.
Enable inviting several players per remote device

The two buttons at the bottom of this screen and the first two items in its Action Bar (or menu) do the same thing. If you like you can hide the buttons to make more games visible.\n\n(If you later want to unhide the buttons go to the Appearance section of App settings).
This game is waiting for the host device to begin the game. That usually means that the host is not communicating (it’s temporarily offline?)
In this case, because the game is expecting more than just this device to connect, it could also mean that it hasn’t invited everybody yet.
To invite via NFC just touch the back of this device against the one you want to invite—any time the game is open.
Every networked game must have at least one way of communicating. If you have no default connection options every new networked game will have to be configured manually.
This game has no way to connect and cannot be saved. Would you like to discard your changes, or edit to give it a way to connect?
Do not notify me no matter how long it’s been my turn
Your device is set up for %1$s. Would you like to download a wordlist so you can play CrossWords in %1$s?
Skip radio when phone numbers same
URL for new MQTT-based relay API
Prefs related to play via internet/relay
Are you sure you want to drop this game’s ability to communicate via the internet?
Bluetooth only works for nearby devices.
Not all carriers support play via Data SMS.

There is a server on the internet that passes messages between devices that are running CrossWords. It works any time you have a fully-functional internet connection, but might have problems on restricted WiFi networks.

Play via Data SMS uses the technology on which “texting” is built. Though the messages are invisible to you, your carrier bills them as texts, so you want to avoid this feature unless you have an unlimited texting plan (or budget.) Note that Android only supports this feature on devices on a GSM carrier, i.e. every carrier in the world except Verizon and Sprint.
Use Bluetooth to play against a nearby device that’s “paired” with yours.
Use WiFi Direct to play against a nearby WiFi Direct-capable device with CrossWords installed.
The “%1$s” option copies an invitation URL to the clipboard. Paste it into the app of your choice and share it with a friend.
Are you sure you want to delete all chat history for this game?\n\n(This action cannot be undone.)
You are using the default player name “%1$s”. Would you like to personalize with your own name before you create this game?
This game has no invitations pending.
This change will take effect after you restart CrossWords.

This game is configured to communicate via Data SMS but CrossWords does not have permission to do so. You can still open the game, but it may not be able to send or receive moves.\n\nYou can re-open it to be asked for permission again. Or you can remove the Data SMS communication setting.

This game is configured to communicate via Data SMS, but the Google Play Store version of CrossWords is no longer allowed to support the Play-by-Data-SMS feature. \n\n You can still open the game, but it may not be able to send or receive moves.
CrossWords needs access to temporary storage to keep what you’re about to download.
CrossWords needs permission to send an invitation via Data SMS.

CrossWords can store and read wordlists in your device’s Downloads area but it needs to ask for permission to access them there.\n\nYou can safely deny this permission if you will never download wordlists except from inside CrossWords and have not previously stored any there.

Some phones can exchange SMS “data” messages. CrossWords would like to offer you this option but needs to ask your device about itself first (to learn if it’s a phone and if so what type.)\n\nIf your device can’t send data SMS (e.g. because it isn’t a phone) or you don’t ever want to play via SMS (e.g. because you pay for each message), it’s safe to permanently deny permission.
To rematch a game that uses Data SMS CrossWords needs permission to access your phone number.
Rematching this Data-SMS-only game is not possible without this permission.
Without this permission rematching will continue but will create a game that cannot play via Data SMS.

CrossWords wants access to your contacts in order to put a name to phone numbers that send you invitations via Data SMS. You’ll still be able to receive invitations if you don’t grant this permission, but only the phone number of the sender will be displayed.
CrossWords needs permission to interact with nearby devices in order to use Bluetooth.
Storing a wordlist in the Downloads area requires Storage permission.

If a scan doesn’t find the device you expect:
 • First, just Rescan
 • Make sure Bluetooth is enabled on the other device
 • Launch CrossWords on the other device
 • If all else fails, reboot this device

You can look up words BEFORE they’re committed as moves—by long-tapping, same as committed words.\n\nUse this feature to check the validity of words you’re thinking of playing, or to look up an unfamiliar word provided as a hint.
(Experimental!!!) Style of play where all players have the same tiles
Same tiles assigned to all players
No players found a move (all passed)
%1$s won this round playing %2$s for %3$d points
Players %1$s tied with %2$d points each. %3$s was played.
This device has sent its moves to the host. When all devices have sent their moves it will be your turn again.
%1$d of %2$d players have reported their moves. When all moves have been received it will be your turn again.
Notice of games being paused and un-paused
Pausing this game will stop the timers, and hide the game, on all devices.
Un-Pausing this game will restart the timers on all devices.
Player %1$s has paused this game, with this explanation: %2$s
Player %1$s has un-paused this game, with this explanation: %2$s
The timer for game “%1$s” expired without any moves being made, so it has been paused for you.

This game did not close properly last time it was opened. \n\nThat can happen when CrossWords is force-closed, but it is possible that the game is damaged and will cause a crash when opened. If that happens you may want to delete it.
Word or words not found in wordlist %2$s: %1$s.
Are you sure you want to erase your debug logs? This action cannot be undone.
There’s a new super-quick way to start a game with somebody you’ve played against before. If the person’s name is listed, just select it and an invitation will be sent immediately.
These are your known remote players. Their names default to what the remote player has chosen, but you can change the names if you want.
Are you sure you want to remove “%1$s” from Known Players?\n\n(This action cannot be undone, but players may reappear if you still have active games with them.)
Unable to change name from “%1$s” to “%2$s”. Is “%2$s” already in use?
Start a solo game using the current defaults
Start a networked game using the current defaults
Start a game by sending an invitation via email, SMS, or even a QR code
OR start a game with somebody you’ve played before, no invitation required
OR start a game after configuring it, e.g. to change the language or number of players

Copying a theme puts a URL in your clipboard. The URL encodes your settings for that theme. Send the URL to another CrossWords user to share your settings: when they tap on the URL on a device with the latest version of CrossWords installed they’ll be able to import your settings.

Would you like to import theme settings from the URL you opened? They will replace any local changes you have made.
\n\nThis action cannot be undone, but you can always restore the default colors for this theme.

The board is now being drawn dark because “Dark theme” is enabled on your device.
\n\nIf you prefer the old “Light” theme, or to choose a theme independent of Android’s “Dark theme” setting, you can change “%1$s” in App Settings at any time. The “Settings” button below will take you there now.
Download of %1$s succeeded. Open it now if you like.
Do NOT attempt to send all messages by MQTT
Select the types of CrossWords data or settings you want to save.
Replace which types of app data in CrossWords with data from the file “%1$s”?
Colors on the game board, e.g. of player names and bonus squares
All App settings except colors, e.g. default language and thumbnail size
All games and other data to identify your device.
Import settings or game data from a file previously exported from CrossWords on this or another device.
The file “%1$s” does not contain CrossWords backup data.

Are you sure you want to overwrite CrossWords’s current games or settings with those from the file “%1$s”?\n\nPlease note that if you are importing networked games from a file created on another device (migrating, that is), you should not continue to use CrossWords on the old device.
(The host is a Known Player called “%1$s”.)
Bogus MQTT devID \"%1$s\". Please try again.
MQTT devID changed to \"%1$s\".\n\nRestarting to ensure use.

Export works on Android 9 (and all other versions), but Import does not. So you can do an export on this device in order to migrate to a newer phone, but you will not be able to import the resulting file on this device.
Import does not work on Android 9.

Please be aware that this wordlist, %1$s, is not available for others to download. This usually means it is custom (built using BYOD), but it could also be obsolete.
\n\nPlease use %1$s only for local games. If you invite someone to a game that uses it you will have to give it to them manually, as CrossWords does not currently support including wordlists in invitations.

This game uses a custom wordlist, %1$s, that cannot be downloaded from the server. Unless the person you invite also has this wordlist, they will not be able to play this game.
\n\nIf you know your opponent has the wordlist %1$s installed, tap Ok to invite them anyway. Or use Game Settings to change the wordlist. Or just delete the game.
Choose how to order players in the new game
The game name will not change once you have edited it unless it is empty.
Allow trades below seven tiles left
This lets you trade tiles when as few as 1 are left in the pool, as is common in Spanish play.
Hide the button that opens the current wordlist
Hide the button that flips the board diagonally
Hide the button that juggles tray tiles
Hide the button that removes or replaces your in-progress move
Hide the button that opens Chat
Hide the button that toggles showing tile values
The most recent move is now drawn using a new background color.\n\nYou can customize that color in %1$s, where the color setting is called “%2$s”.
Are you sure you want to clear saved “legal phonies”?\n\nThis action cannot be undone.
CrossWords needs your permission to post notifications, e.g. telling you an opponent has moved or that a updated wordlist is available.
Keep this many hours of logs
Are you sure you want to permanently delete stats?
CrossWords is staying awake to check for remote moves. Tap for more information.
Keep CrossWords awake to receive moves, even when it is not visible or the device is asleep. Note: may impact battery life.

For the best experience with networked games, CrossWords can try to remain active in the background checking for incoming moves. This may reduce battery life, which is why Android discourages it, and why you will always see a notification when it is happening.
The Move Checker only runs when a move has been made in at least one networked game in the last %1$d hours. You can configure it, or disable it altogether, using the “%2$s” button below.
The Move Checker has been running for %1$dh%2$02dm. It will stop in %3$dh%4$02dm unless a move is made or received before then.
The Move Checker is not currently running.
The Move Checker is currently disabled.
If you get tired of seeing the notification you can use your device’s Settings app to hide it. Get there with the button below.
How many hours to stay awake
CrossWords will receive moves from other players more quickly if you enable the new Move Checker feature. The More info button will tell you how.
Post a notification when the Move Checker is stopped (usually because it’s been too long since a move was sent or received.)
